segment.source: About App-V 5.0 SP2
segment.target: About App-V 5.0 SP2

segment.source: About App-V 5.0 SP2
segment.target: About App-V 5.0 SP2

segment.source: About App-V 5.0 SP2
segment.target: About App-V 5.0 SP2

segment.source: App-V 5.0 SP2 provides an improved integrated platform, more flexible virtualization, and powerful management for virtualized applications.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 SP2 provides an improved integrated platform, more flexible virtualization, and powerful management for virtualized applications.

segment.source: For more information see, App-V 5.0 Overview (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=325265).
segment.target: For more information see, App-V 5.0 Overview (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=325265).

segment.source: Changes in Standard App-V 5.0 SP2 Functionality
segment.target: Changes in Standard App-V 5.0 SP2 Functionality

segment.source: The following sections contain information about the changes in standard functionality for App-V 5.0 SP2.
segment.target: The following sections contain information about the changes in standard functionality for App-V 5.0 SP2.

segment.source: Support for Windows Server 2012 R2 and Windows 8.1
segment.target: Support for Windows Server 2012 R2 and Windows 8.1

segment.source: App-V 5.0 includes support for Windows Server 2012 R2 and Windows 8.1
segment.target: App-V 5.0 includes support for Windows Server 2012 R2 and Windows 8.1

segment.source: App-V 5.0 SP2 now supports folder redirection for the user’s roaming AppData directory
segment.target: App-V 5.0 SP2 now supports folder redirection for the user’s roaming AppData directory

segment.source: App-V 5.0 SP2 supports roaming AppData (%AppData%) folder redirection.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 SP2 supports roaming AppData (%AppData%) folder redirection.

segment.source: For more information, see the Planning to Use Folder Redirection with App-V.
segment.target: For more information, see the Planning to Use Folder Redirection with App-V.

segment.source: Package upgrade improvements and pending tasks
segment.target: Package upgrade improvements and pending tasks

segment.source: In App-V 5.0 SP2, you are no longer prompted to close a running virtual application when a newer version of the package or connection group is published.
segment.target: In App-V 5.0 SP2, you are no longer prompted to close a running virtual application when a newer version of the package or connection group is published.

segment.source: If a package or connection group is in use when you try to perform a related task, a message displays to indicate that the object is in use, and that the operation will be attempted at a later time.
segment.target: If a package or connection group is in use when you try to perform a related task, a message displays to indicate that the object is in use, and that the operation will be attempted at a later time.

segment.source: Tasks that have been placed in a pending state will be performed according to the following rules:
segment.target: Tasks that have been placed in a pending state will be performed according to the following rules:

segment.source: Task type
segment.target: Task type

segment.source: Applicable rule
segment.target: Applicable rule

segment.source: User-based task, e.g., publishing a package to a user
segment.target: User-based task, e.g., publishing a package to a user

segment.source: The pending task will be performed after the user logs off and then logs back on.
segment.target: The pending task will be performed after the user logs off and then logs back on.

segment.source: Globally based task, e.g., enabling a connection group globally
segment.target: Globally based task, e.g., enabling a connection group globally

segment.source: The pending task will be performed when the computer is shut down and then restarted.
segment.target: The pending task will be performed when the computer is shut down and then restarted.

segment.source: When a task is placed in a pending state, the App-V client also generates a registry key for the pending task, as follows:
segment.target: When a task is placed in a pending state, the App-V client also generates a registry key for the pending task, as follows:

segment.source: User-based or globally based task
segment.target: User-based or globally based task

segment.source: Where the registry key is generated
segment.target: Where the registry key is generated

segment.source: User-based tasks
segment.target: User-based tasks

segment.source: KEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\AppV\Client\PendingTasks
segment.target: KEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\AppV\Client\PendingTasks

segment.source: Globally based tasks
segment.target: Globally based tasks

segment.source: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\AppV\Client\PendingTasks
segment.target: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\AppV\Client\PendingTasks

segment.source: Virtualizing Microsoft Office 2013 and Microsoft Office 2010 using App-V 5.0
segment.target: Virtualizing Microsoft Office 2013 and Microsoft Office 2010 using App-V 5.0

segment.source: Use the following link for more information about App-V 5.0 supported Microsoft Office scenarios.
segment.target: Use the following link for more information about App-V 5.0 supported Microsoft Office scenarios.

segment.source: Virtualizing Microsoft Office 2013 for Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0
segment.target: Virtualizing Microsoft Office 2013 for Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This document focuses on creating a Microsoft Office 2013 App-V 5.0 Package.
segment.target: This document focuses on creating a Microsoft Office 2013 App-V 5.0 Package.

segment.source: However, it also provides information about scenarios for Microsoft Office 2010 with App-V 5.0.
segment.target: However, it also provides information about scenarios for Microsoft Office 2010 with App-V 5.0.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 Client Management User Interface Application
segment.target: App-V 5.0 Client Management User Interface Application

segment.source: In previous versions of App-V 5.0 the Client Management User Interface (UI) was provided with the App-V 5.0 Client installation.
segment.target: In previous versions of App-V 5.0 the Client Management User Interface (UI) was provided with the App-V 5.0 Client installation.

segment.source: With App-V 5.0 SP2 this is no longer the case.
segment.target: With App-V 5.0 SP2 this is no longer the case.

segment.source: Administrators now have the option to deploy the App-V 5.0 Client UI as a Virtual Application (using all supported App-V deployment configurations) or as an installed application.
segment.target: Administrators now have the option to deploy the App-V 5.0 Client UI as a Virtual Application (using all supported App-V deployment configurations) or as an installed application.

segment.source: For more information see Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0 Client UI Application (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=386345).
segment.target: For more information see Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0 Client UI Application (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=386345).

segment.source: Side-by-Side (SxS) Assembly Automatic Packaging and Deployment
segment.target: Side-by-Side (SxS) Assembly Automatic Packaging and Deployment

segment.source: App-V 5.0 SP2 now automatically detects side-by-side (SxS) assemblies, and deployment on the computer running the App-V 5.0 SP2 client.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 SP2 now automatically detects side-by-side (SxS) assemblies, and deployment on the computer running the App-V 5.0 SP2 client.

segment.source: A SxS assembly primarily consists of VC++ run-time dependencies or MSXML.
segment.target: A SxS assembly primarily consists of VC++ run-time dependencies or MSXML.

segment.source: In previous versions of App-V, virtual applications that had dependencies on VC run-times required these dependencies to be locally on the computer running the App-V 5.0 SP2 client.
segment.target: In previous versions of App-V, virtual applications that had dependencies on VC run-times required these dependencies to be locally on the computer running the App-V 5.0 SP2 client.

segment.source: The following functionality is now supported:
segment.target: The following functionality is now supported:

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 sequencer automatically captures the SxS assembly in the package regardless of whether the VC run-time has already been installed on the computer running the sequencer.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 sequencer automatically captures the SxS assembly in the package regardless of whether the VC run-time has already been installed on the computer running the sequencer.

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 client automatically installs the required SxS assembly to the computer running the client as required at publishing time.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 client automatically installs the required SxS assembly to the computer running the client as required at publishing time.

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 sequencer reports the VC run-time dependency using the sequencer reporting mechanism.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 sequencer reports the VC run-time dependency using the sequencer reporting mechanism.

segment.source: The App-V 5.0 sequencer now allows you to exclude the VC run-time dependency in the event that the dependency is already available on the computer running the sequencer.
segment.target: The App-V 5.0 sequencer now allows you to exclude the VC run-time dependency in the event that the dependency is already available on the computer running the sequencer.

segment.source: Publishing Refresh Improvements
segment.target: Publishing Refresh Improvements

segment.source: App-V 5.0 supports several features were added to improve the overall experience of refreshing a set of applications for a specific user.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 supports several features were added to improve the overall experience of refreshing a set of applications for a specific user.

segment.source: The following list displays the publishing refresh enhancements:
segment.target: The following list displays the publishing refresh enhancements:

segment.source: The following list contains more information about how to enable the new publishing refresh improvements.
segment.target: The following list contains more information about how to enable the new publishing refresh improvements.

segment.source: EnablePublishingRefreshUI - Enables the publishing refresh progress bar for the computer running the App-V 5.0 Client.
segment.target: EnablePublishingRefreshUI - Enables the publishing refresh progress bar for the computer running the App-V 5.0 Client.

segment.source: HideUI - Hides the publishing refresh progress bar during a manual sync.
segment.target: HideUI - Hides the publishing refresh progress bar during a manual sync.

segment.source: New Client Configuration Setting
segment.target: New Client Configuration Setting

segment.source: The following new client configuration setting is available with App-V 5.0 SP2:
segment.target: The following new client configuration setting is available with App-V 5.0 SP2:

segment.source: EnableDynamicVirtualization - Enables supported Shell Extensions, Browser Helper Objects, and Active X controls to be virtualized and run with virtual applications.
segment.target: EnableDynamicVirtualization - Enables supported Shell Extensions, Browser Helper Objects, and Active X controls to be virtualized and run with virtual applications.

segment.source: For more information, see About Client Configuration Settings.
segment.target: For more information, see About Client Configuration Settings.

segment.source: App-V 5.0 Shell extensions
segment.target: App-V 5.0 Shell extensions

segment.source: App-V 5.0 SP2 now supports shell extensions.
segment.target: App-V 5.0 SP2 now supports shell extensions.

segment.source: For more information see the App-V 5.0 SP2 shell extension support section of Creating and Managing App-V 5.0 Virtualized Applications.
segment.target: For more information see the App-V 5.0 SP2 shell extension support section of Creating and Managing App-V 5.0 Virtualized Applications.

segment.target: App-V 5.0 SP2 provides updated documentation for the following scenarios:

segment.source: How to Get MDOP Technologies
segment.target: How to Get MDOP Technologies

segment.source: App-V 5.0 is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).
segment.target: App-V 5.0 is a part of the Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP).

segment.source: MDOP is part of Microsoft Software Assurance.
segment.target: MDOP is part of Microsoft Software Assurance.

segment.source: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=322049).
segment.target: For more information about Microsoft Software Assurance and acquiring MDOP, see How Do I Get MDOP (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=322049).
